name: unpleasantly

More examplesFewer examplesThe village is a major tourist attraction and can be unpleasantly crowded in midsummer. It has a good, strong taste but isn’t unpleasantly bitter. Constance looked up at him and smiled unpleasantly."I don't believe that for a moment," said Mr Fang unpleasantly. If summer travellers are expecting to see the same sorts of air fares they saw last summer, they're going to be very unpleasantly surprised.
